author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Chennai City Traffic Police have started distributing packets of lime juice and buttermilk to traffic police personnel, manning signals in the city, on Sunday, to help them cope with the rising temperature.

A senior official of the Chennai City Traffic Police said hundreds of traffic police personnel posted at the traffic signals in and around the city had been feeling the heat, even though summer was yet to set in, and this had necessitated the move.

A total of 5,000 packets of lime juice/buttermilk would be distributed every day to the police personnel manning 1,250 signal junctions.

The distribution would continue in the months of March, April and May.
title: Cool liquids for traffic police to beat the heat
